In-class Exercise 9: Geographically Weighted Random Forest

Published

March 13, 2023

1 Installing packages

pacman::p_load(sf, spdep, GWmodel, SpatialML, tidyverse, tmap, ggpubr, olsrr, devtools, tidymodels)

# essential packages include: sf, spdep, GWmodel, SpatialML, tidyverse

2 Preparing data

2.1 Reading data file into rds

Reading the input data sets. It is in simple feature data frames.

mdata<-read_rds("data/aspatial/mdata.rds")
summary(mdata)

2.2 Random sampling

set.seed(1234) #whenever code requires randomisation, remember to set seed
resale_split<-initial_split(mdata,
                            prop=6.5/10,)
train_data<-training(resale_split)
test_data<-testing(resale_split)
write_rds(train_data, "data/model/train_data.rds")
write_rds(test_data, "data/model/test_data.rds")

3 Computing the

4 Reading data

train_data<- read_rds("data/model/train_data.rds")
test_data<- read_rds("data/model/test_data.rds")

5 buidling a non spatial multiple linear regression

price_mlr<- lm(resale_price~floor_area_sqm + storey_order + remaining_lease_mths + PROX_CBD + PROX_ELDERLYCARE + PROX_HAWKER + PROX_MRT + PROX_PARK + PROX_MALL + PROX_SUPERMARKET + WITHIN_350M_KINDERGARTEN + WITHIN_350M_CHILDCARE + WITHIN_350M_BUS + WITHIN_1KM_PRISCH, data=train_data)

summary(price_mlr)

Call:
lm(formula = resale_price ~ floor_area_sqm + storey_order + remaining_lease_mths + 
    PROX_CBD + PROX_ELDERLYCARE + PROX_HAWKER + PROX_MRT + PROX_PARK + 
    PROX_MALL + PROX_SUPERMARKET + WITHIN_350M_KINDERGARTEN + 
    WITHIN_350M_CHILDCARE + WITHIN_350M_BUS + WITHIN_1KM_PRISCH, 
    data = train_data)

6 GWR predictive method

gwr method will be used to calibrate a model to predict the HDB resale prices

train_data_sp<- as_Spatial(train_data)
train_data_sp

features    : 10335 
extent      : 11597.31, 42623.63, 28217.39, 48741.06  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)

7 Computing adaptive bandwidth

we can use geographically weighted method to calibrate model

8 Random forst method

8.1 Preparing coordinate data

8.1.1 Extracting coordinates data

coords<-st_coordinates(mdata)
coords_train<-st_coordinates(train_data)
coords_test<-st_coordinates(test_data)

Save into rds

coords_train<-write_rds(coords_train, "data/model/coords_train.rds")
coords_test<-write_rds(coords_test, "data/model/coords_test.rds")

Read RDS

coords_train<-read_rds("data/model/coords_train.rds")
coords_test<-read_rds("data/model/coords_test.rds")

8.2 Dropping geometry field

Drop geometry column of the sf dataframe by using st_drop_geometry()

train_data<-train_data |> 
  st_drop_geometry()

8.3 forming model

set.seed(1234)
rf<- ranger(resale_price~floor_area_sqm + storey_order + remaining_lease_mths + PROX_CBD + PROX_ELDERLYCARE + PROX_HAWKER + PROX_MRT + PROX_PARK + PROX_MALL + PROX_SUPERMARKET + WITHIN_350M_KINDERGARTEN + WITHIN_350M_CHILDCARE + WITHIN_350M_BUS + WITHIN_1KM_PRISCH, data=train_data)

summary(rf)
                          Length Class         Mode     
predictions               10335  -none-        numeric  
num.trees                     1  -none-        numeric  
num.independent.variables     1  -none-        numeric  
mtry                          1  -none-        numeric  
min.node.size                 1  -none-        numeric  
prediction.error              1  -none-        numeric  
forest                        7  ranger.forest list     
splitrule                     1  -none-        character
treetype                      1  -none-        character
r.squared                     1  -none-        numeric  
call                          3  -none-        call     
importance.mode               1  -none-        character
num.samples                   1  -none-        numeric  
replace                       1  -none-        logical  
print(rf)
Ranger result

Call:
 ranger(resale_price ~ floor_area_sqm + storey_order + remaining_lease_mths +      PROX_CBD + PROX_ELDERLYCARE + PROX_HAWKER + PROX_MRT + PROX_PARK +      PROX_MALL + PROX_SUPERMARKET + WITHIN_350M_KINDERGARTEN +      WITHIN_350M_CHILDCARE + WITHIN_350M_BUS + WITHIN_1KM_PRISCH,      data = train_data) 

Type:                             Regression 
Number of trees:                  500 
Sample size:                      10335 
Number of independent variables:  14 
Mtry:                             3 
Target node size:                 5 
Variable importance mode:         none 
Splitrule:                        variance 
OOB prediction error (MSE):       731404460 
R squared (OOB):                  0.9493789

Comparing the R squared, we see that model’s explanatory power increases using ranger. Comparing MSE, remb to take the square root of MSE

8.4 Geographic random forest using grf

set.seed(1234)
gwRF_adaptive<-grf(formula = resale_price~floor_area_sqm + storey_order + remaining_lease_mths + PROX_CBD + PROX_ELDERLYCARE + PROX_HAWKER + PROX_MRT + PROX_PARK + PROX_MALL + PROX_SUPERMARKET + WITHIN_350M_KINDERGARTEN + WITHIN_350M_CHILDCARE + WITHIN_350M_BUS + WITHIN_1KM_PRISCH,
                   dframe=train_data,
                   bw=55, # need to know how to calculate using function
                   kernel="adaptive",
                   coords=coords_train)

determine bandwidth: - use grf.bw(formula, dataset, kernel, coordinates)

results: 1. explanatory variable stats 2. predictive model stats

write_rds(gwRF_adaptive, "data/model/gwRF_adaptive.rds")

Read rds file into R

gwRF_adaptive<-read_rds("data/model/gwRF_adaptive.rds")

9 Predicting by using test data

9.1 Preparing test data

Code chunck below will be used to combine the test data with its corresponding coordinates data.

test_data<-cbind(test_data, coords_test) |> 
  st_drop_geometry()

9.2 Predicting test data

using predict.grf()

gwRF_pred<-predict.grd(gwRF_adpative,
                       test_data,
                       x_var.name="X",
                       local.w=1, #calibrate local version
                       global.w=0)

plot ggplot (predicted values versus fitted model) - compare with ols plot
